text:
Stop writing ‘act as an expert.’ It’s a terrible prompt.

Ask this to ChatGPT instead:

Give it a clear persona that matches your task.

Because most people write prompts like this:

→ Act as an expert marketer
→ Act as a software engineer
→ Act as a business consultant

... and then wonder why the output feels generic. 

That’s because you gave the model a generic role. 
↳ So it gives you generic content.

The fix? Be specific.
Here’s how to upgrade your prompts:

❌ Act as an expert marketer
✅ Act as a conversion psychologist who crafts landing pages that trigger buyer emotions.

❌ Act as a software engineer
✅ Act as a backend engineer optimizing high-load APIs for a fintech platform.

❌ Act as a data analyst
✅ Act as a storytelling analyst, turning retention metrics into board-ready slides.
